Posts.Content: edwh001 wrote: Hi all waiting on my results for a biopsy I had Wed had a ultrasound and doc noticed some thickening of the uterus and since I'm on Tamoxifen its got to be checked but I'm still scared, has anyone else had this? I could use your prayers. Thanks all, Darlene Roll Tide Dx 8/4/2006, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/19 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 8/9/2006 Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Left Chemotherapy 8/22/2006 AC Hormonal Therapy 11/23/2006 Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2011 10:14AM - edited Oct 9, 2013 10:04AM by edwh001 Darla I am so sorry about your son and what your going through, I could not even think about my child having cancer. But cancer runs in my family and 5 out of 6 siblings have had it and my brother is getting a biopsy today for his second cancer and I go the 25th for one. My prayers and thoughts are with you and your family. Emmy
Posts.Title: Out of remission, now my son has cancer mcbird edwh001

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2012 03:13PM - edited Jan 24, 2012 03:13PM by edwh001 Hi all, I am happy to say I did not have reconstruction 5 years ago ( at the time did'nt know my ins would pay for it). For the first few years I was unsure of what to do or if I could get it done. My ins would not pay for a bilateral mastectomy so I wear a prosthesis when away from home. I wish I could of had a bilateral, I know I would of been happier, more freedom to just put on a shirt and go. For me the less cutting on me the better. Like most of you I wanted to get on with my life and did'nt want any more pain or complications, so yes now I am happy I did not get reconstruction. Emmy
Posts.Title: No reconstruction- Happy w/your decision? marlee1 quietpools
